posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
A few questions and comments, in no particular order of importance...

RDD qualifier class
Why not bard? UMD means high-level scrolls & items are suddenly available. A brief scroll wish list might be something like Magic Vest, Neg nrg Protect, Freedom, Death Ward, Owl's Insight (+3 WIS AC)... just to mention a few defensive ones. Now, that would mean at least 2 levels of bard (one for RDD prereq and at least 1 dump level to get at least 34 modified ranks). With such a high AC, I wouldn't miss Armor Skin from one lost RDD bonus feat.

Ability spread
Why WIS 14... for WIS AC? Seems AB is your main problem as 39 is lowish for level 40. Even with the monk progression intact it will become difficult to hit once you've begun encountering hostiles over level 30 (I suppose you are depending on at least +10 kamas to help with that). My start split would be STR 12 (or 10)-DEX 18-CON 12 (or 14)-WIS 8-INT 14-CHA 8. As far a STR goes, that's what all those magic bags are used for. With a finesse build, STR does little... so even at 12, 2 more points seem wasted to me. With DEX at 18 you'll be getting +1AC +1 reflex and sorely needed +1AB.

Skills
Why such a high Search level? Trap detection is a modal d20 roll plus Search ranks. Maybe hidden doors? At least for HotU, 10-15 ranks plus INT mod + d20 has been pretty reliable for me.

Understand, it's been a long time since I played the Nether Scrolls and SoF modules so can't recall the monster stats or equipment spawns. Comments/questions were based on a generic environment rather than a high-magic one like it appears this build is designed for.

Most likely because of Alignment issues since Bard can't be lawful.

I agree the AB is a bit low but it probably won't be a problem going through the OC. I don't know anything about the Sands of Fate but it will be an issue since this guy's role is to melee.

However, a bigger concern I have with this build is the lack of Uncanny Dodge on a Dex'er. A STR of 22 means +6 to damage. You can get the same by going Fighter and grabbing Weapon Spec and Epic Weapon Spec. I think you're better off with a Monk 30 / Fighter 5 / SD 5 (or Monk 25 / Fighter 10 / SD 5) with Epic Dodge, Epic Weapon Spec and Uncanny Dodge. If you're worried about loot, throw some Lore in there to help ID items to see what you want to keep. In the OC, there are also plenty of STR enhancing equipment as well.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
UBAB?

A "pure" 3/4 BAB class like the Monk. Rogue, Bard, etc has 15 BAB in the first 20 levels.
Here it says BAB: 24 which means that his pre-epic BAB is 14 (always subtract 10 from the level 40 number).

To gain the maximum number of attacks you want a pre-epic AB of at least 16, that is part of the reason we mix a full-BAB class into these 3/4 BAB classes.
A 16/4 split pre-epic assures that you will have a BAB of 16.

But here Empyre could not do that since RDD need an arcane class to get into such as sorcerer or bard.
In compensation, he gets all these awesome RDD buffs plus ITWF to make up for the fewer attacks.

posts.content: I have learned a lot in the 7 years since this build. Now, I would just go with a purely strength-based build. The AC would be lower, but not totally awful because of the full Tumble, the +5 from 25 levels of Monk and +4 from 10 levels of RDD, and the AB and damage would be higher.

For instance, if you mix in enough rogue levels in a fighter build, you will lose both AB and you will reduce from 4 attacks per round to 3 attacks per round. I am trying to figure out what happens when you mix in interesting classes into monk. How many levels of Sorc/Wiz can you mix in the pre-epic progression before you lose number of attacks? Cornflower wrote:Now, the reason for asking is that I haven't found out how multiclassing affects the monk's regular attack bonuses when unarmed. For instance, if you mix in enough rogue levels in a fighter build, you will lose both AB and you will reduce from 4 attacks per round to 3 attacks per round. I am trying to figure out what happens when you mix in interesting classes into monk. How many levels of Sorc/Wiz can you mix in the pre-epic progression before you lose number of attacks? That's my question really. You can always figure out how much AB you lose, because as you pointed out, you can subtract 10 from lvl 40, but I can't see anywhere how many attacks per round you lose.
It's no different than for any other class - you need to reach a BAB of 16 to get 4 attacks (ignoring Flurry). Monk is 3/4, so if you are Monk 20 you get a BAB of 15. This means that of you take 4 of those levels in a high BAB class you will get to 16. You can replace Monk with other Medium BAB classes, like Rogue, on a like-for-like basis, without changing the numbers. Then there's Cleric and Divine Power...

And then you add the Monk's extra attacks if Unarmed or using Kamas. You get an extra attack at level 10 and another at level 20.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: This build is for single-player, where you spend most of your time on the way to level 40, so pre-level-40 playability is more important than on a server where you spend most of your time at level 40.  For example, at level 20, this build has +1 AB and +1 AC compared to a pure Monk, and also more health and +2 damage.
